csplugins.data
Interface DataMatrixLens

All Known Implementing Classes:
DataPropertyMap
public interface DataMatrixLens

Implements a filtered view of a data matrix, reflecting user changes to column order, column enabling, and row selection.

Method Summary
 double[] adjustForColumnOrderAndState(double[] row)
          use column ordering, and column status, to create and return a possibly transformed view of the data row

getRowIndexFromSelection

int getRowIndexFromSelection(int index)
This method takes as its argument an int representing an index of one of the selected rows. It returns the index of that row in the underlying matrix. Do we really need a method for this? TODO - find a better name for this method.

Parameters:
index -
Returns:

getUnmaskedColumnTitles

java.lang.String[] getUnmaskedColumnTitles()
Deprecated. Use getAllColumnTitles() instead.

Returns the unfiltered column titles in the unfiltered column order.

getAllColumnTitles

java.lang.String[] getAllColumnTitles()
Returns the unfiltered column titles in the unfiltered column order.

getFilteredColumnTitles

java.lang.String[] getFilteredColumnTitles()
Returns the filtered column titles, along with the header column which is always at position 0. The following always holds true: getFilteredColumnTitles().length = getEnabledColumnCount() + 1;

Returns:

toString

java.lang.String toString(boolean allRows)
Returns a string representation of this DataMatrixLens

Parameters:
allRows - Whether to show all rows (true) or just the selected rows.
Returns:
